intro: Helenium parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered sneezeweed, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and bright orange to yellow ray flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom from late summer to early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Helenium parviflorum is often found in moist soils along stream banks and wet meadows.
